itemDescription: British barrister and diplomat, Governor of Montserrat (2007–2011)

wikipedia_page.main: Peter Andrew Waterworth (born 15 April 1957) is a British barrister and diplomat, who was the Governor of Montserrat from 2007 to 2011.

response: At least 5 alumni have held ambassadorial level posts in the Foreign Office. They include: Kim Darroch, previously British Ambassador to the United States; former High Commissioner to Jamaica David Fitton; former High Commissioner to Bangladesh David Carter; Bruce Bucknell, a former British Ambassador to Belarus; and William Quantrill, who served as Ambassador to Cameroon. Peter Waterworth, an ex-Senior Man, was Governor of Montserrat from 2007 to 2011.

In March 2010, he was appointed Governor of Montserrat, replacing Peter Waterworth who was retiring from the diplomatic service. Davis was sworn in as Governor on 8 April 2011.New Governor sworn into office, Antigua Observer, 11 April 2011. His term as Governor ended on 8 July 2015. Elizabeth Carriere was sworn in as his replacement on 5 August.http://zjb.gov.ms/2015/07/07/news-for-tuesday-july-7-2015/
* Peter Waterworth (born 1957), British barrister and diplomat

link_mentions.page: List of governors of dependent territories in the 21st century

response: He finished his degree in 1978, receiving a 2.2. One of his classmates was the future broadcaster George Alagiah, while fellow undergraduates in the same cohort at Hatfield College included the rugby player Jeremy Campbell-Lamerton and Peter Waterworth, then Senior Man, and in later life Governor of Montserrat.Durham University Gazette, pp. 64–66
